meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.9.0 released!
meta.summary: New features include fluent queries in SQL clients, a new Redis client, an updated Kafka client, an improved Future API, and many more things.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.9.1 released!
meta.summary: The new version comes with many enhancements including an SQL client for DB2 and out-of-the-box support for HTTP/2 on JDK 8.

meta.title: Easy SSO for Vert.x with Keycloak
meta.summary: In this blog post, you'll learn how to implement Single Sign-on with OpenID Connect and how to use Keycloak together with Eclipse Vert.x.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Building services and APIs with AMQP 1.0
meta.summary: Microservices and APIs are everywhere. Everyone talks about them, presentation slides are full of them ... some people are actually even building them.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 3.7.0 released!
meta.summary: We are extremely pleased to announce that the Eclipse Vert.x version 3.7.0 has been released.
